item.title: Report X-2025061117
item.description:
Report X-2025061117

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed two plastic bottles inside that had warning stickers. After obtaining the SDS the contents were a class 8 UN3264. The outer fiberboard box didn't have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location for the FAA.

item.description:
Report X-2025060123

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-30
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO THREE PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DUMPLINGS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZV6520H0225500098 AND 1ZV6520H0212706613.

item.title: Report X-2025052069
item.description:
Report X-2025052069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: SEA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AWB 3301-6686 1 @ 51 was accepted by my agent on 5/6/2025. The shipper stated this was "camping gear." Mike asked him the trigger questions like is there anything flammable or any aerosol cans. The shipper said no. When Mike screened the shipment, he saw two aerosol cans. He then proceeded to perform a physical search which turned up two aerosol cans, 2 bic lighters, waterproof matches, thermacell mosquito repellant, and seam grip seam sealer. Shipment was then put on hold.

item.title: Report X-2025050660
item.description:
Report X-2025050660

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING BUILD UP FOR ANOTHER FREIGHTER, RSA AGENTS DECIDED TO OPEN UP THE TOOLBOXES T SEE WHAT WAS IN IT. THEY DISCOVERED BATTERIES AND OTHER ITEMS LIKE A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. THEY CALLED ME OVER TO LOOK AT IT AND I ALERTED MANAGEMENT TO TAKE A DEEPER LOOK. WE COMPLETED A PHYSICAL SEARCH AND TOOK PICTURES OF ITEMS THAT MIGHT BE DG. THE REST WERE JUST NUTS AND BOLTS.
